p:
RRV disease is generally treated with paracetamol or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), with many patients being satisfied with this treatment. 8, 9 Anecdotal evidence suggests different NSAIDs may need to be tried.
2 Standard risks and contraindications for NSAID use in patients with conditions including asthma, peptic ulcer, cardiovascular and renal disease should be considered. Aspirin is used by some patients (but is not recommended for chikungunya
4 ). Steroids are not generally recommended.
11 Although a vaccine has been tested in phase III human trials,
7 this is not commercially available.
